extendedInfo.description: Wanna transfer a file to your friend nearby you? But he or she is not in your contact list? This app may help you.SonicShare is a new way to send files. You do not need the wifi tethering, bluetooth, gps, nor input any ip, cloud link, email address, tel, id, nor select the names from a long contact list (but finally found that he is not in your list :P) In order to achieve a file transfer, the only thing you need is your friends are nearby you, both open this app, select the file/item, and click the SEND button. The file will be passed to your friends' devices. Simple enough?You can send any kinds of file. jpg, mp3, wmv, mp4, txt, xls, pdf, apk .... no format limitation. Besides the files, by using the interface provides by this app, you can also send URL, sms text, contact, android apps (apk), app market link, clipboard content, your predefined name card, web history, ... This app also supports 1-to-many transfer, which means if you want to share a file to 10 friends, you just send once, then all your friends will receive the sent file in a few minutes. Interesting?BTW, why do not use Bluetooth? Yes, bluetooth does the same thing. But it requires many approval steps and some compatibility problems between devices. Do you have any bad experience in sending files via bluetooth but fail finally after tons of annoying steps? I have many. :PIf you want to contact me or want to be one of the developers, drop me a mail at cantfactory@gmail.comThanks a lot of trying my apps. Enjoy ...Please read the faq at http://sonic.cantfactory.com/faq.phpSoftware Compatibility:It supports android version from 2.0 to 4.0.4(ICS).Hardware Compatibility:From my record, the following models can operate this app without problem:[Samsung]Galaxy S (GT-I9000)Galaxy S+ (GT-I9001)Galaxy SL (GT-I9003)Galaxy S2 (GT-I9100)Galaxy Note (GT-N7000)Galaxy Tab 7 (GT-P1000)Galaxy Tab 7.7 (GT-P6800)Galaxy Mini (GT-S5570L)Galaxy Ace (GT-S5830)Galaxy Ace L (GT-S5830L)Galaxy Nexus (mysid)Galaxy Nexus (yakju)Galaxy Nexus (yakjusc)DoCoMo Galaxy Tab (SC-01C)DoCoMo Galaxy S (SC-02B)DoCoMo Galaxy S2 (SC-02C)DoCoMo Galaxy Tab 7 (SC-02D)DoCoMo Galaxy Note (SC-05D)AT&T Galaxy S2 (SGH-I777)AT&T Galaxy S (SGH-I997)Admire (SCH-R720)[HTC]Desire HD (htc_ace)Desire(htc_bravo)ChaCha (htc_chacha)Thunderbolt (htc_mecha)Sensation (htc_pyramid)Sensation XL (htc_unnymede)EVO 4G (htc_supersonic)EVO 3D CDMA (HTI12)Vigor (htc_vigor)Desire-Z (htc_vision)Mytouch 4G (full_glacier)Nexus One (passion)Ville (ville)[Sony]Xperia Arc S (LT18i_1255-1481)Xperia S (LT26i_1257-9045)Xperia mini pro (SK17a)Xperia NX (SO-02D)[Motorola]Droid RAZR(spyder_vzw)Droid Bionic(targa_vzw)Defy (MB525)MB300 (motus_att_us)[LG]Optimus (elini)Optimus One P500 (thunderg)Gelato NFC (lge_gelato)[Others]Gigabyte G-Smart (G1355)Huawei S7 Slim (SLIM_MTN_ZA)DoCoMo F-05D (f11sha)Not compatible:[Sony]X10*[Saumsung]Galaxy Tab 8.9Galaxy Tab 10.1*** Tested in some tabs which without telephony function. It can send signal but cannot receive. I found that their microphone cannot detect frequency higher than 16000 Hz. Sorry to say that this app cannot support those hardwares.

reviews.title: Good idea, But..
reviews.comment: I think you are using microwaves to share the data. Can you please explain what sound frequencies have you used to transfer the data? Also, please explain How did you generate such high frequencies on android hardware currently available? How are you receiving such high frequencies on the target device(s)? Are there no filters(digital or analogue) available on currently available android devices for audio input and output?
reviews.author: Arsalan Masood

reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No ICS support? You upload files to your server?
reviews.comment: I cannot use this on my tablet, so I assume it is not ICS friendly even though it says \"Android 2.1 and up\". Can only use on my phone but would be nice to be able to do phone to tablet or vice versa. Also, you uploading files to the server and claiming to delete in 15 minutes is a bit scary to me. The cartoon GUI is kind of tough too deal with long term I think. Pretty cool idea, but without tablet or ICS support it is a little limiting and the file server upload could get dicey IMHO. That means.. they could peak at your dirty photos.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Violation of privacy
reviews.comment: This app wants my unique identifier and my phone number uhh I don\'t think so. How ridiculous is this getting all these developers want all your personal for any little app these days. Sorry not getting mine. Shame it was a good idea.
reviews.author: A Google User
